did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Spotsylvania County (Va.) Miscellaneous Court Records, ca. 1770-1790

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Spotsylvania County (Va.) Miscellaneous Court Records, ca. 1770-1790. Local government records collection, Spotsylvania County Court Records. The Library of Virginia, Richmond, Va. 23219.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: These items came to the Library of Virginia under the accession number 35517.

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: Spotsylvania County was formed in 1720 from Essex, King and Queen, and King William counties.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Spotsylvania County (Va.) Miscellaneous Court Records, ca. 1770-1790. Consists of an oath, 1783; two summons, 1774 and 1783; a fragment of a fee book; and a bond (negotiable instrument), 1786.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Additional Spotsylvania County Court Records can be found with Spotsylvania County Court records on microfilm at The Library of Virginia. See http://www.lva.lib.va.us/whatwehave/local/local_rec/index.htm.
